I found some old Christmas cards the other day and had a lovely time reading them and reminiscing about the people who sent them.
That must have been nice. I keep cards too.
It was so nice. I'm terrible about throwing cards out. I feel, if someone's taken the time to write, I should preserve it. Does that sound silly?
Not at all! I think it's a lovely sentiment. It's nice to have something tangible to look back on and remember the people who have been in our lives.

I don't think so. I'm more of a collector.

There was an incident where one of my back neighbors called my young son a name and made fun of him. I was so mad, beyond angry!
An adult did this?

Yes, and she had two children of her own, similar in age. Her son also weighed more than mine! She did it because my son rode his bike through the corner of her yard as rode around the circle, that made her mad! Can you believe that??
I dont get people sometimes. Who does that that sort of thing.

I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.
Where you not secure in your self?
Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!
I am sorry to hear that.

So I forgot to get my son a bag of chips from the store today.
Was he upset?
He kinda gave me the Mom, really? look but I told him that we'd ride to the store in the morning b/c I looked around the kitchen and realized there was other stuff I forgot.  *chuckle*
I hate when that happens.
I do, too.  I tend to get 'mom brain' at the worst times!  I'll be happy when he is old enough to get his own chips [he's 10 now].
I hate ggrocery shopping period. Too many decisions
It's easier with a list but still, you always remember the one thing off of the list and then it turns into TEN things off of the list.  XD
Exactly! It's like, why did I even bother making a list in the first place?  It's so frustrating.  Have you found any strategies that make it easier?

I'm teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!
That is wonderful, I imagine she is very excited.
She is!  At first, though, she was very nervous.  I told her we could start off slow - her dad lives 1 mile from me down a quiet road, so we started driving back and forth between the two houses.
That sounds like a lot of fun, I am sure she will enjoy it a lot.
